function.name: webkit_web_frame_load_string
function.description:
Requests loading of the given @content with the specified @mime_type, @encoding and @base_uri.
If @mime_type is %NULL, "text/html" is assumed.
If @encoding is %NULL, "UTF-8" is assumed.
Since: 1.1.1

parameter.name: base_uri
parameter.parameter_description: the base URI for relative locations

function.name: webkit_web_view_go_to_back_forward_item
function.description: Go to the specified #WebKitWebHistoryItem
function.return: %TRUE if loading of item is successful, %FALSE if not

function.name: webkit_web_view_get_uri
function.description: Return value: the URI of @web_view

function.name: webkit_web_policy_decision_ignore
function.description:
Will send the IGNORE decision to the policy implementer.
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_network_request_set_uri
function.description: Sets the URI held and used by the given request. When the request has an associated #SoupMessage, its URI will also be set by this call.

function.name: webkit_web_view_reload_bypass_cache
function.description:
Reloads the @web_view without using any cached data.
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_web_policy_decision_use
function.description:
Will send the USE decision to the policy implementer.
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_web_view_get_full_content_zoom
function.description: Return value: %FALSE if only text should be scaled (the default),
function.return:
%FALSE if only text should be scaled (the default), %TRUE if the full content of the view should be scaled.
Since: 1.0.1

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_get_current_item
function.description: Returns a NULL value if the back forward list is empty Return value: a #WebKitWebHistoryItem

function.name: webkit_download_get_current_size
function.description: Current already downloaded size.

function.name: webkit_web_navigation_action_get_modifier_state
function.description: Return value: a bitmask with the state of the modifier keys
function.return:
a bitmask with the state of the modifier keys
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_download_start
function.description:
Initiates the download. Notice that you must have set the destination-uri property before calling this method.
Since: 1.1.2

function.name: webkit_web_settings_new
function.description: Creates a new #WebKitWebSettings instance with default values. It must be manually attached to a WebView.

function.name: webkit_web_navigation_action_set_reason
function.description:
Sets the reason why WebKit is requesting a navigation.
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_web_view_unmark_text_matches
function.description: Removes highlighting previously set by webkit_web_view_mark_text_matches.

function.name: webkit_web_view_get_zoom_level
function.description: Return value: the zoom level of @web_view

function.name: webkit_download_get_network_request
function.description: Retrieves the #WebKitNetworkRequest object that backs the download process.

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_get_forward_item
function.description: Returns a NULL value if there nothing that succeeds the current item Return value: a #WebKitWebHistoryItem

function.name: webkit_web_frame_get_parent
function.description: Return value: the parent #WebKitWebFrame or %NULL in case there is none
function.return: the parent #WebKitWebFrame or %NULL in case there is none

function.name: webkit_web_view_go_back
function.description: Loads the previous history item.

function.name: webkit_web_view_set_editable
function.description:
Sets whether @web_view allows the user to edit its HTML document.
If @flag is %TRUE, @web_view allows the user to edit the document. If @flag is %FALSE, an element in @web_view's document can only be edited if the CONTENTEDITABLE attribute has been set on the element or one of its parent elements. You can change @web_view's document programmatically regardless of this setting. By default a #WebKitWebView is not editable.
Normally, an HTML document is not editable unless the elements within the document are editable. This function provides a low-level way to make the contents of a #WebKitWebView editable without altering the document or DOM structure.

function.name: void
webkit_web_view_get_paste_target_list
function.description: This function returns the list of targets this #WebKitWebView can provide for clipboard pasting and as DND destination. The targets in the list are added with %info values from the #WebKitWebViewTargetInfo enum, using gtk_target_list_add() and gtk_target_list_add_text_targets().

function.name: webkit_web_view_can_go_forward
function.description: Determines whether #web_view has a next history item.
function.return: %TRUE if able to move forward, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: webkit_web_view_load_uri
function.description:
Requests loading of the specified URI string.
Since: 1.1.1

function.name: webkit_web_view_get_progress
function.description:
Determines the current progress of the load.
Since: 1.1.7

function.name: webkit_download_set_destination_uri
function.description:
Defines the URI that should be used to save the downloaded file to.
Since: 1.1.2

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_get_back_list_with_limit
function.description: Return value: a #GList of items preceding the current item, limited by @limit

parameter.name: limit
parameter.parameter_description: the number of items to retrieve

function.return: a #GList of items preceding the current item, limited by @limit

function.name: webkit_web_view_set_custom_encoding
function.description:
Sets the current #WebKitWebView encoding, without modifying the default one, and reloads the page.
Since: 1.1.1

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.parameter_description: the new encoding, or %NULL to restore the default encoding

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_get_nth_item
function.description: Return value: the #WebKitWebHistoryItem located at the specified index relative to the current item
function.return: the #WebKitWebHistoryItem located at the specified index relative to the current item

function.name: webkit_web_view_open
function.description:
Requests loading of the specified URI string.
Deprecated: 1.1.1: Use webkit_web_view_load_uri() instead.

function.name: webkit_web_frame_print_full
function.description:
Prints the given #WebKitFrame, using the given #GtkPrintOperation and #GtkPrintOperationAction. This function wraps a call to gtk_print_operation_run() for printing the contents of the #WebKitWebFrame.
Since: 1.1.5

function.name: webkit_web_view_get_encoding
function.description: Return value: the default encoding

function.name: webkit_download_get_progress
function.description: Determines the current progress of the download.

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_go_to_item
function.description: Go to the specified @web_history_item in the back forward list

function.name: webkit_download_get_uri
function.description: Convenience method to retrieve the URI from the #WebKitNetworkRequest which is being downloaded.

function.name: webkit_web_settings_get_user_agent
function.return:
the User-Agent string currently used by the web view(s) associated with the @web_settings.
Since: 1.1.11

function.name: webkit_web_frame_get_title
function.description: Return value: the title of @frame

function.name: webkit_web_view_zoom_in
function.description:
Increases the zoom level of @web_view. The current zoom level is incremented by the value of the "zoom-step" property of the #WebKitWebSettings associated with @web_view.
Since: 1.0.1

function.name: webkit_download_cancel
function.description:
Cancels the download. Calling this will not free the #WebKitDownload object, so you still need to call g_object_unref() on it, if you are the owner of a reference. Notice that cancelling the download provokes the emission of the WebKitDownload::error signal, reporting that the download was cancelled.
Since: 1.1.2

function.name: webkit_web_settings_copy
function.description: Copies an existing #WebKitWebSettings instance.

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_new_with_web_view
function.description: Creates an instance of the back forward list with a controlling #WebKitWebView

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_add_item
function.description:
Adds the item to the #WebKitWebBackForwardList.
The @webBackForwardList will add a reference to the @webHistoryItem, so you don't need to keep a reference once you've added it to the list.
Since: 1.1.1

function.name: WebKitWebSettings
function.description:
Whether to enable HTML5 offline web application cache support. Offline Web Application Cache ensures web applications are available even when the user is not connected to the network.
Since 1.1.13

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_get_back_item
function.description: Return value: the #WebKitWebHistoryItem preceding the current item

function.name: webkit_web_view_set_maintains_back_forward_list
function.description: Set the view to maintain a back or forward list of history items.

parameter.name: flag
parameter.parameter_description: to tell the view to maintain a back or forward list

function.name: webkit_web_navigation_action_set_original_uri
function.description:
Sets the URI that was originally requested. This may differ from the navigation target, for instance because of a redirect.
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_web_frame_new
function.description: Creates a new #WebKitWebFrame initialized with a controlling #WebKitWebView.
function.return:
a new #WebKitWebFrame
Deprecated: 1.0.2: #WebKitWebFrame can only be used to inspect existing frames.

function.description: Return value: a #gint corresponding to the nuber of items succeeding the current item
function.return: a #gint corresponding to the nuber of items succeeding the current item

function.name: webkit_web_view_move_cursor
function.description:
Move the cursor in @view as described by @step and @count.
Since: 1.1.4

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: integer describing the direction of the movement. 1 for forward, -1 for backwards.

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_contains_item
function.description:
Checks if @web_history_item is in the back forward list
Return: %TRUE if @web_history_item is in the back forward list, %FALSE if it doesn't

function.description: Attempts to select everything inside the @web_view.

function.description: Pastes the current contents of the clipboard to the @web_view.

function.name: webkit_web_view_get_title
function.description: Return value: the title of @web_view

function.name: webkit_web_history_item_get_last_visisted_time
function.description: Return value: the time in seconds this @web_history_item was last visited
function.return: the time in seconds this @web_history_item was last visited

function.name: webkit_web_view_can_show_mime_type
function.description: This functions returns whether or not a MIME type can be displayed using this view.
function.return:
a #gboolean indicating if the MIME type can be displayed
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_download_new

function.name: webkit_web_frame_load_uri
function.description:
Requests loading of the specified URI string.
Since: 1.1.1

function.description:
Requests loading of the specified asynchronous client request.
Creates a provisional data source that will transition to a committed data source once any data has been received. Use webkit_web_view_stop_loading() to stop the load.
Since: 1.1.1

function.name: webkit_web_navigation_action_get_original_uri
function.description: Return value: the originally requested URI

function.name: webkit_web_view_search_text
function.description: Looks for a specified string inside #web_view.

parameter.name: forward
parameter.parameter_description: whether to find forward or not

parameter.name: case_sensitive
parameter.parameter_description: whether to respect the case of text

parameter.name: wrap
parameter.parameter_description: whether to continue looking at the beginning after reaching the end

function.name: WebKitWebInspector
function.description:
This is enabling JavaScript profiling in the Inspector. This means that Console.profiles will return the profiles.
Since: 1.1.1

function.name: webkit_web_history_item_get_uri
function.description: Return value: the URI of @web_history_item

function.name: webkit_web_settings_add_extra_plugin_directory
function.description:
Adds the @directory to paths where @web_view will search for plugins.
Since: 1.0.3

function.description: Returns: the expected total size of the downloaded file
function.return:
the expected total size of the downloaded file
Since: 1.1.2

function.name: webkit_web_view_get_inspector
function.description: Obtains the #WebKitWebInspector associated with the #WebKitWebView. Every #WebKitWebView object has a #WebKitWebInspector object attached to it as soon as it is created, so this function will only return NULL if the argument is not a valid #WebKitWebView.
function.return:
the #WebKitWebInspector instance associated with the #WebKitWebView; %NULL is only returned if the argument is not a valid #WebKitWebView.
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_web_history_item_get_original_uri
function.description: Return value: the original URI of @web_history_item

function.name: webkit_get_default_session
function.description: Retrieves the default #SoupSession used by all web views. Note that the session features are added by WebKit on demand, so if you insert your own #SoupCookieJar before any network traffic occurs, WebKit will use it instead of the default.

function.name: webkit_download_get_destination_uri
function.description: Obtains the URI to which the downloaded file will be written. This must have been set by the application before calling webkit_download_start(), and may be %NULL.

function.name: webkit_web_back_forward_list_go_back
function.description: Steps backward in the back forward list

function.name: webkit_web_view_get_copy_target_list
function.description: This function returns the list of targets this #WebKitWebView can provide for clipboard copying and as DND source. The targets in the list are added with %info values from the #WebKitWebViewTargetInfo enum, using gtk_target_list_add() and gtk_target_list_add_text_targets().

function.name: webkit_web_view_can_go_back
function.description: Determines whether #web_view has a previous history item.
function.return: %TRUE if able to move back, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: WebKitWebNavigationAction
function.description:
The target frame for the navigation.
Since: 1.1.13

function.name: webkit_web_frame_load_request
function.description:
Connects to a given URI by initiating an asynchronous client request.
Creates a provisional data source that will transition to a committed data source once any data has been received. Use webkit_web_frame_stop_loading() to stop the load. This function is typically invoked on the main frame.

function.name: webkit_web_frame_load_alternate_string
function.description:
Request loading of an alternate content for a URL that is unreachable. Using this method will preserve the back-forward list. The URI passed in @base_url has to be an absolute URI.
Since: 1.1.6

parameter.name: content
parameter.parameter_description: the alternate content to display as the main page of the @frame

parameter.name: base_url
parameter.parameter_description: the base URI for relative locations

parameter.name: unreachable_url
parameter.parameter_description: the URL for the alternate page content

function.name: webkit_web_view_set_transparent
function.description:
Sets whether the #WebKitWebView has a transparent background.
Pass %FALSE to have the #WebKitWebView draw a solid background (the default), otherwise %TRUE.

function.name: webkit_web_window_features_new
function.description: Creates a new #WebKitWebWindowFeatures instance with default values. It must be manually attached to a WebView.

parameter.name: short_description

function.description:
Determines the current status of the load.

Will send the DOWNLOAD decision to the policy implementer.

Controls whether window will be displayed fullscreen.
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_network_request_get_soup_message
function.description: Obtains the #SoupMessage held and used by the given request. Notice that modification of the SoupMessage of a request by signal handlers is only supported (as in, will only affect what is actually sent to the server) where explicitly documented.

function.name: webkit_download_get_elapsed_time
function.description: Elapsed time for the download in seconds, including any fractional part. If the download is finished, had an error or was cancelled this is the time between its start and the event.
function.return:
seconds since the download was started, as a #gdouble
Since: 1.1.2

function.name: webkit_web_frame_get_uri
function.description: Return value: the URI of @frame

function.name: webkit_web_inspector_get_web_view
function.description: Obtains the #WebKitWebView that is used to render the inspector. The #WebKitWebView instance is created by the application, by handling the #WebKitWebInspector::inspect-web-view signal. This means that this method may return %NULL if the user hasn't inspected anything.
function.return:
the #WebKitWebView instance that is used to render the inspector or %NULL if it is not yet created.
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_web_frame_stop_loading
function.description: Stops any pending loads on @frame's data source, and those of its children.

function.name: webkit_web_view_has_selection
function.description: Determines whether text was selected.
function.return: %TRUE if there is selected text, %FALSE if not

function.name: webkit_web_view_zoom_out
function.description:
Decreases the zoom level of @web_view. The current zoom level is decremented by the value of the "zoom-step" property of the #WebKitWebSettings associated with @web_view.
Since: 1.0.1

function.name: webkit_web_view_set_highlight_text_matches
function.description: Highlights text matches previously marked by webkit_web_view_mark_text_matches.

function.name: webkit_web_view_go_forward
function.description: Loads the next history item.

function.name: webkit_web_inspector_get_inspected_uri
function.description: Obtains the URI that is currently being inspected.
function.return:
a pointer to the URI as an internally allocated string; it should not be freed, modified or stored.
Since: 1.0.3

function.name: webkit_web_settings_get_spell_languages

Internal use only. Retrieves a GSList of SpellLanguages from the #WebKitWebSettings of @web_view.
Since: 1.1.6

function.description: Return value: the #WebKitWebBackForwardList

Prints the given #WebKitFrame, by presenting a print dialog to the user. If you need more control over the printing process, see webkit_web_frame_print_full().

function.name: webkit_web_view_set_zoom_level
function.description:
Sets the zoom level of @web_view, i.e. the factor by which elements in the page are scaled with respect to their original size. If the "full-content-zoom" property is set to %FALSE (the default) the zoom level changes the text size, or if %TRUE, scales all elements in the page.
Since: 1.0.1

function.name: webkit_web_view_get_editable
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @web_view allows the user to edit the HTML document, %FALSE if Return value: a #gboolean indicating the editable state

function.return: a #gint corresponding to the number of items preceding the current item

function.name: webkit_micro_version
function.description: The micro version number of the WebKit that is linked against.

function.description: Obtains the current status of the download, as a #WebKitDownloadStatus.

function.name: webkit_download_get_suggested_filename

Since: 1.1.7

function.name: webkit_web_view_mark_text_matches
function.description: Attempts to highlight all occurances of #string inside #web_view.

parameter.parameter_description: whether to respect the case of text

parameter.name: limit
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum number of strings to look for or %0 for all

function.name: webkit_web_view_can_go_back_or_forward
function.description: Determines whether #web_view has a history item of @steps. Negative values represent steps backward while positive values represent steps forward.
function.return: %TRUE if able to move back or forward the given number of steps, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: webkit_web_view_go_back_or_forward
function.description: Loads the history item that is the number of @steps away from the current item. Negative values represent steps backward while positive values represent steps forward.
